comments.commentBody: this is the same dumb building that obsessed over "tasteful" bi-tri-multi-ethnic christmas decorations and wound up with something that could only be described as pseudo holiday anaesthesia Lite.  the people there spend way too much time regulating their neighbors' behaviors and preferences and trying to turn everyone into people just like them.   what a prune-faced bunch of scoldies!   but there ought to be a serious legal challenge here.   fining people because you don't like what they do?  there ought to be an equal fine imposed for each and every instance of a neighbor filing complaints against a neighbor.  call it a filing fee.  $150 for your first complaint, same scale as for smokers.  then maybe the building would have some money to spend on decent christmas decorations!

I agree with Tessa (#5) that prepackaged food programs are not for everyone. People who join them with no intent to learn how to exercise, deal with emotional triggers/temptations and prepare healthy meals for themselves after the prepackaged food period ends are going to have trouble keeping off the weight they lost. However, people who just need a portion-size reboot or simply breathing room to learn the above-mentioned skills without the burden of cooking for themselves while they learn can do just fine.

I was on Jenny Craig for three months and lost 20 pounds. The food was great, the plan was easy, and while I did not continue to lose weight after I stopped the program, I haven't gained back those 20 pounds (18 months later). The only reason I quit the program was the cost.

Losing weight and then maintaining proper body weight requires lifelong changes in attitudes toward food. It is possible to use Dr. Willet's teachings for that purpose. The Jenny Craig method requires a dependence on others for food preparation. Dr. Willet educates for lifetime use. Additionally, there are few who can afford programs like Jenny Craig, so it is not suitable for most by definition. The ultimate goal should not be reduction of a given amount of weight, but an attempt to approach calculated "ideal" weight......in my opinion.This is a project that usually requires many months particularly if the dieter is to avoid nutritional deficiencis.

I believe the disclosure for the objective of the Jenny Craig diet should have been made by CU up front instead of a competitor, Weight Watchers.  I think CU has forfeited a good portion of its credibility outside its traditional areas of expertise.  CU you have done a disservice to an audience desperate for anything that works for greater than 5% of the population for more than 5 years

Hi,

I use an app called SIPS. The "SIPS Child" app is on my daughters phone (free app) an "SIPS Parent" is on my phone. My daughter and I discuss expectations, and safety, and I'm able to set a maximum speed limit, and a geographic boundary. I get a text alert when she exceeds the speed limit, or leaves the boundary. I also get notified if she is texting while driving.

I find this "real-time" notifications helpful in doing "course corrections" with her (and consequences). Also, I know she is making safer decisions because she knows there will be consequences if she does not. But, the consequences are far better than if she were to ever be in an accident.

@northxnorthwest
ny

You said "the fact that he took advantage of this defenseless woman" then "He will be presumed innocent until and unless the prosecution prove to a jury that he is guilty of the charges brought against him." It seems like you contradict yourself here.

He should be presumed innocent until proven guilty, and therefore any guess like "taking advantage of an innocent girl" shouldn't be marked as fact.

For those of you who believe that this is "frightening control," do you not understand that smoking is genuinely frightening control over people who share vents and other air with you? Do you really think that you have a right to give a neighbor or family member cancer?

This board vote gives me hope that a few Americans are still willing to think of the greater good, not just themselves.

Look, second hand smoke is a carcinogen plain and simple, different from other offending odors. I lived in Manhattan, loud noise, cooking smells, cockroaches from my neighbor didn't cause me cancer. Children in a recent study living in a smoke-free apartment within a smoking multi-unit housing complex had a 45% increase in nicotine blood levels compared to children living in a private free standing house (Wilson, 2011 Pediatrics). The nicotine came from neighbors smoking and the smoke doesn’t have to come from right next door because it travels throughout a building due to air pressure and ventilation systems, along plumbing and electrical lines (Winickoff, 2010, NEJM). Kids and pregnant women need to be protected – women need to speak up on this matter, for each other and our children.  Keep smoking if you want, just don’t expose others to it. Mark it on your calendar, ten years from now no smoking in apartments, condos will be the norm.
The robust stench in the halls of most Manhattan rentals, coops, and condos has little to do with cigarettes.

comments.userLocation: Lewis Family Farm, Essex, New York
comments.commentBody:
If it comes to a head - will case law be the result? Or will the AG settle for money and the usual.

When it's money and no case law, it's a scalp without the word.

The Economy Is Still at the Brink, by Sandy Lewis and William D. Cohan, OP ED, June 7th, 2009, The New York Times - is the one to read.

We would not change a word.

We witnessed predatory capitalism of the same cut and stripes as Bernie Madoff's, but on a massive, complicated, and wink, wink, conniving scale. That the public was made to bear the risk and underwrite bailouts (during a Republican administration, mind you) and that non-prosecution guarantees were exacted and huge bonuses paid to corporate executives beggars the imagination and is an on-going insult to us all. Criminal and civil proceedings are one way of righting the scales of justice and restoring faith in America Were there no patriots in the houses of Wall Street? Bravo to the New York A.G. for reopening the investigations. Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness.

Thanks, and thanks again, to New York's brave Governor and A.G.!   You've landed your proverbial helicopter in the compound of Wall Street: seriously an important event for the entire country.  Our prayers are with you.

Thank you Mr. Attorney General. I now feel I will live to see the day that these bankster criminals might end up in jail, with no bonuses just bars.They have destroyed countless lives. I am so proud of my city for taking the biggest step so long overdue in this massive crime. Are you listening AG Holder?

VG: If Bing results are on par with Google, it's because Microsoft has been caught -- literally -- stealing Google results and reposting them. When Google began suspecting this to be the case, it intentionally seeded non-existent Web pages in certain searches, then searched on Bing. What a coincidence, suddenly those results popped up as well.

Going back to topic, I am now even less likely to use Bing than before. The only tech company I trust less than Google and Facebook is Microsoft.
Interesting column, but JFK is in NYC!  JFK is in Queens, and Queens is part of NYC, since 1898.  The population is presently about 2.3 million.
And what happens to this world when the rising price of jet fuel ultimately makes air travel unfeasible for all save the narrowest band of consumers?

It is, in my estimation, genuinely unfortunate that either the Republican Party really believes that legislation of this sort will actually achieve its stated goals (nebulous as they might be) or the Party is cynical enough to pander to the very basest instincts of an increasingly beleaguered and frightened domestic voting population. I certainly cannot accept that it was offered in the belief that it would actually accomplish anything that might burnish the reputation of the United States of America abroad. Nobody, not even the current incarnation of the GOP is quite that deluded...I hope.

And how do they propose to pay for these excursions; more tax cuts, less healthcare, less education, less infrastructure investment; more lives lost, more for them, less for the needy? The very thought that this drumbeat continues should be convincing enough that the inmates are running the asylum. This has got to be a bad dream. Wake up america, we've gone down the rabbit hole and have been taken over by mad hatters.

The scenario you describe would seem more likely, if the Republican proposal were to prevail: "This wildly expansive authorization would, in essence, make the war on terror a permanent and limitless aspect of life on earth, along with its huge potential for abuse."

We cannot ever let our guards down, but can we keep it off our shores, and see that our interests and friends are protected with our 'unique' intelligence capabilities? Please?

When Richard Dawkins wrote "The Selfish Gene", he wasn't writing about how evolution favors selfish actions among species. He was writing about how genes themselves selfishly try to replicate themselves. If causing an organism to act in a cooperative and kind way increases that organism's chances of survival, a selfish gene would benefit from having that effect.

"But if cooperation permeates our nature, then so does morality, and there is no escaping ethics, emotion and religion in our quest to understand who we are and how we got this way."

There is no need to study religion to understand how we got this way. If cooperation is the result of evolution favoring group cohesion, then we have to explain how religion was built upon this cooperation, not the other way around.

David, nicely written.

Perhaps in a future article you might point out the distinction between useful economic systems that increase the material benefits of cooperation based on self interest (such as regulated free enterprise systems) and useful moral systems that increase the emotional as well as material benefits of cooperation by unselfish behaviors as described by Martin Nowak. Conservative Republicans often (and Randians always) mistake these useful economic systems for moral systems.

A little bit of science could do a lot to straighten out this painful level of confusion.

Some of the other comments here are very good and I look forward to reading their website postings.

Seems pretty straight forward: cooperation and other moral traits, including religion, may have evolved since they can provide us a leg up. Though not personally of a Republican bent, I've come in contact with a few and for the most part they're pretty nice folks, even cooperative, you might say.
"Yankees’ Five-Game Home Slide Was Low Point of 2009".  See my previous post (No. 3) above.

'... but refusing to work with any government that includes Hamas.'

...now that the Palestinian government is going to include Hamas. Kind of boring. If Abbas was left-handed, no doubt Netanyahu would be open to anything -- as long as it didn't involve negotiating with a leftie.
